newsitem.title: USA: Trump to buy back 1.25 mln additional shares.
newsitem.headline: Trump to buy back 1.25 mln additional shares.

text.p: Trump Hotels & Casino Resorts Inc said Wednesday its board authoritized the repurchase of an additional 1.25 million of the company's commmon shares.
The move follows the repurchase of 1,241,100 shares under a previously announced common stock repurchase program, at prices ranging from 9.125 to $12.63 a share, or an average of $10.27 a share.
The repurchase program is effective until the end of 1997, and shares may be purchased in the open market or in privately negotiated transactions, the company said.

Donald Trump, chairman, said the decision to buy back the company's stock "underscores management's confidence in the company's future and is an opportunity to further build and maximize shareholder value."

Trump Hotels owns and operates Trump Plaza Hotel & Casino, Trump Taj Mahal Casino Resort and Trump's Castle Casino Resort in Atlantic City. N.J. It also owns and operates Trump Indiana, a riveboat casino at Buffington Harborn, Ind., on Lake Michigan.
